department_name: Glenn County Environmental Health Department - Planning & Community Development Services

grading_system.description: Glenn County does not appear to use a formal letter grading or numerical scoring system. They classify violations as Critical, Major, and Minor but no evidence found of A/B/C grades or numerical scores on inspection reports.

inspection_details.frequency: Unknown - no specific frequency information found for Glenn County
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Critical violations must be corrected at time of inspection and may require follow-up inspection. Re-inspection not usually required for minor violations only.
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Inspection reports posted online as scanned PDFs, updated every few weeks. Reports available since August 1, 2006.

fire_safety_authority.department_name: Multiple fire protection districts serve Glenn County (Artois-Glenn, Orland, Hamilton City, Kanawha-Glenn, Ord, Glenn-Codora Fire Protection Districts)

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CalCode) - part of California Health and Safety Code, effective July 1, 2007
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level inspections conducted by Glenn County Environmental Health Department
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Unknown - no specific local ordinances beyond state food code found

confidence_notes: Could not verify grading/scoring system, inspection frequencies, or specific fire safety authority requirements. Glenn County appears to use violation classification (Critical/Major/Minor) rather than grades or scores. Fire authority is fragmented across multiple fire protection districts.
verification_notes: Manual verification needed for: 1) Confirmation of no formal grading system vs. undisclosed grading system, 2) Specific inspection frequency schedules and risk-based criteria, 3) Which fire protection district has authority over commercial kitchen inspections and specific hood/suppression system requirements, 4) Any local ordinances beyond state food code requirements.
